subject: Communication
title: Internal Storytelling: Culture as Narrative
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Internal Storytelling: Culture as Narrative.

hook.text: At Amazon, meetings start by reading a 6-page narrative memo in silence. No PowerPoints allowed.

buildup.text: Jeff Bezos banned slides because they hide weak thinking. Narrative forces clear, connected reasoning.

discovery.text: Internal stories â€” founding myths, hero employees, legendary failures â€” define company culture more than any handbook.

twist.text: Organizations without shared stories fracture. People need narratives to understand 'why we do things this way.'

climax.text: The best leaders are storytellers: they narrate where the company came from, where it's going, and why it matters.

punchline.text: Culture isn't rules. It's the stories people tell each other.

quiz.question: Why did Jeff Bezos ban PowerPoint at Amazon?
options: Because narrative memos force clearer thinking
